required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 09, 2023
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Visual Perceptual Motor Training on Kindergarteners
clinical_study.official_title: Effects of Different Visual-perceptual-motor Training Courses on Kindergarten Children

brief_summary.textblock: The study aims to investigate the effects of different visuomotor training programs on children's visuomotor skills and handwriting performance.

detailed_description.textblock: The purpose of this project is to investigate the effectiveness of visuomotor activities with different activity materials on fine motor, visual perception, visual-motor integration and handwriting performance of kindergarten children. Kindergarteners will be randomized into the three groups: control, Chinese, and traditional groups. Children in the Chinese and traditional groups will receive a visual perceptual motor training program twice every week for 12 weeks and those in the control group will not receive any intervention during the study period. in the end of fall semester of the first grade, the effectiveness of the interventional programs on handwriting performance of participants will be examined again.

study_design_info.masking_description: The assessors are blinded to the assigned group of participants

primary_outcome.time_frame: baseline, after 12-week intervention, through study completion, an average of 1 year
primary_outcome.description: the change of the handwriting performance

primary_outcome.time_frame: baseline, after 12-week intervention, through study completion, an average of 1 year
primary_outcome.description: the change of the Chinese character recognition ability

primary_outcome.measure: The Chinese Handwriting Evaluation Form (preschool version)
primary_outcome.description: the change of handwriting performance by kindergarten teacher's rating

primary_outcome.measure: The Chinese Handwriting Evaluation Form (School-aged version)
primary_outcome.time_frame: through study completion, an average of 1 year
primary_outcome.description: the change of handwriting skills by teacher's rating

primary_outcome.measure: The Battery of Chinese Basic Literacy
primary_outcome.time_frame: through study completion, an average of 1 year
primary_outcome.description: the change of reading and handwriting skills

secondary_outcome.measure: Test of Visual Perceptual Skills-Fourth Edition (TVPS-4)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: baseline, after 12-week intervention, through study completion, an average of 1 year
secondary_outcome.description: the change of visual perceptual skills

secondary_outcome.measure: The Bruininks-Oseretsky Test of Motor Proficiency-Second Edition (BOT-2)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: baseline, after 12-week intervention, through study completion, an average of 1 year
secondary_outcome.description: the change of fine motor skills

secondary_outcome.measure: The Berry-Buktenica Developmental Test of Visual-Motor Integration- Forth Edition (VMI)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: baseline, after 12-week intervention, through study completion, an average of 1 year

arm_group.description: visual perceptual motor activities using Chinese characters as activity materials.
visual perceptual motor activities using commercial or self-designed toys and pencil-paper sheets as activity materials.

intervention.description: this program includes visual-perceptual-motor play, paper-pencil activities, and ipad games using Chinese character as activity materials
this program includes play and paper-and-pencil activities, ipad games using commercial or self-designed stuffs as activity materials

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Kindergarten children who will study the first grade in coming September
- Both parents are native Mandarin Chinese speakers
Exclusion Criteria:
- A diagnosis of significant neurological, muscular, and skeletal system disorders
- Visual or hearing problems that cannot be corrected to be normal
- Genetic or chromosomal abnormality
- Significant neurological, muscular, and skeletal damage to the trunk or upper extremities
- moderate or severe intellectual disabilities
